thread.title: Man accused of shooting at cops gets prison on gun charges
thread.title_full: Man accused of shooting at cops gets prison on gun charges - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-

author: wcax.com
title: Man accused of shooting at cops gets prison on gun charges
text:
NEW YORK (AP) - A former U.S. soldier who prosecutors say was disguised in a fake beard and planning to attack his one-time defense lawyer when he instead shot at two police officers has been sentenced to more than 12 years in prison for weapons convictions.
Antonio Olmeda was sentenced Thursday by federal Judge Richard Berman in Manhattan. Berman noted that Olmeda had been commended for his sharpshooting skills before being honorably discharged from the military.
The judge said a stiff sentence was necessary to deter Olmeda and others from using weapons illegally.
Before he was sentenced, Olmeda complained that prosecutors tried to use against him a state court case in which he's charged with shooting at the officers, even though he still awaits trial.
Olmeda was arrested days after the December 2011 shooting in Queens.
